revision.comment: Remove blank line(s) between list items per [[WP:LISTGAP]] to fix an accessibility issue for users of [[screen reader]]s. Do [[WP:GENFIXES]] and cleanup if needed. Discuss this at [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Accessibility#LISTGAP]]
revision.text:
{|{{Infobox ship begin |sclass=2}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox ship class overview |Name=Military class |Builders=[[Cook, Welton & Gemmell]], [[Beverley]] |Operators={{Navy|United Kingdom}} |Class before= |Class after= |Subclasses= |Cost= |Built range= 1941–1944 |In service range= |In commission range= 1943–1945 |Total ships building= |Total ships planned= |Total ships completed=9 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active= |Total ships laid up= |Total ships lost= nil |Total ships retired= |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= <ref>Conway p67</ref> |Ship class= |Ship type=[[Naval trawler]] |Ship tonnage= |Ship displacement= {{Convert|830|LT|t|0|lk=in}} |Ship length= {{Convert|193|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{Convert|30|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught= {{Convert|14.10|ft|m|abbr=on}}
|Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion=Reciprocating engine, 1 shaft |Ship speed= {{Convert|12.5|kn|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship complement=40 |Ship crew= |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=*1 × [[QF 4 inch Mk XIX naval gun|4in/40 QF]] gun *4-8 × [[Oerlikon 20 mm cannon|Oerlikon 20 mm]] AA guns *65 × [[depth charge]]s |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |}
The '''Military class''' of [[Admiralty trawler]]s was a small class of [[Fishing trawler|trawlers]] built for the British [[Royal Navy]] during the [[Second World War]].
The vessels were intended for use as [[Minesweeper (ship)|minesweepers]] and for [[anti-submarine warfare]], and the design was based on a commercial type, the ''Lady Madeleine'' by [[Cook, Welton & Gemmell|Cook Welton and Gemmell]] of [[Beverley]].<ref>Elliott p286</ref> The purpose of the order was to make use of specialist mercantile shipyards to provide vessels for war use by adapting commercial designs to [[Admiralty]] specifications.
Between 1941 and 1943 the Royal Navy ordered nine such vessels from Cook Welton and Gemmel. All saw active service, but none were lost in action.
The Military class trawlers were the largest trawlers built for the Royal Navy and bear comparison with the [[Flower class corvette]]s.<ref>Conway p67</ref>
==Ships== * ''Bombardier'' (T304), completed 19 May 1943 * ''Coldstreamer'' (T337), completed 10 April 1943 * ''Fusilier'' (T305), completed 30 April 1943 * ''Grenadier'' (T334), completed 10 February 1943 * ''Guardsman'' (T393), completed 22 August 1944 * ''Home Guard'' (T394), completed 10 September 1944 * ''Lancer'' (T335), completed 25 February 1943 * ''Royal Marine'' (T395), completed 30 October 1944 * ''Sapper'' (T336), completed 19 March 1943
==See also == * [[Trawlers of the Royal Navy]]
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==References== * Conway : ''Conways All the Worlds Fighting Ships'' 1922-1946 (1980) ISBN 0-85177-146-7 *Elliott, Peter: ''Allied Escort Ships of World War II'' (1977) ISBN 0-356-08401-9
==External links== * [http://www.uboat.net/allies/warships/class.html?ID=331 Military class trawlers at uboat.net]
